casebody.data:
William Paul HIATT, Petitioner-Appellant, v. Doyal SMITH, Warden, Putnam County Prison, Respondent-Appellee. No. 71-2512

Summary Calendar.*

United States Court of Appeals, Fifth Circuit. Feb. 1, 1972. Edward T. M. Garland, Atlanta, Ga., for petitioner-appellant. Arthur K. Bolton, Atty. Gen. of Ga., Harold N. Hill, Jr., Executive Asst. Atty. Gen., Courtney Wilder Stanton, Asst. Atty. Gen., Dorothy T. Beasley, W. Hen-sell Harris, Jr., Deputy Asst. Attys. Gen., Atlanta, Ga., for respondent-appellee.

Before THORNBERRY, MORGAN and CLARK, Circuit Judges.

Rule 18, 5th Cir.; see Isbell Enterprises, Inc. v. Citizens Casualty Co. of New York et al., 5th Cir. 1970, 431 F.2d 409, Part I.

 PER CURIAM:

On the basis of our decision in Smith v. Smith, 5th Cir. 1971, 454 F.2d 572, the judgment of the district court is reversed and the cause is remanded for a new trial.
